Road trip Jakarta - Semarang awal November ini cukup menyita tenaga krn  cuaca yg luar biasa panas. Oleh karena itu, kami memutuskan untuk rehat di slh 1 kota yg kami lewati. dan jatuhlah pada Kota Pekalongan 

Saya memesan The Sidji Hotel melalui aplikasi Traveloka, selain karena app review yg bagus, beberapa teman saya juga pernah bercerita kalau The Sidji Hotel Pekalongan termasuk hotel yg recommended dgn harga yg terjangkau.

Sampai di hotel, kami disambut ramah oleh para staf Front Office. Proses check-in juga sgt singkat. Kami diantar menuju lift oleh staf hotel.

Ketika pertama kali datang, kesan klasik sangat kental sekali di hotel yg terletak tidak jauh dari alun-alun kota. Ornamen batik khas pekalongan yang menghiasi lorong dan juga kamar, bagi kami sangat menarik sekali.

Kamar hotel The Sidji tergolong luas, dan nyaman dgn fasilitas yg oke, termasuk koneksi internet yang tersedia. Pilihan channel di TVpun juga beragam. Dan view kolam renang dr jendela kamar, juga sangat memanjakan mata. 

Menu sarapan di The Sidji cukup lengkap, dan yang membuat saya senang, karena ada megono, kuliner khas Pekalongan.

Secara umum, kami puas selama menginap di the Sidji Hotel.
title: A memorable stay in the Sidji Hotel Pekalongan

text:
Pelayanan receptionist yg kurang tanggap, mungkin karena akan ada acara wedding yg diadakan malam harinya jd seluruh staff tidak memperhatikan tamu hotel. Saat check in salah satu kamar dari 2 kamar yg saya pesan belum siap padahal saya check in pukul 4 sore, lalu setelah menyerahkan kunci receptionist jg tidak memberi pengarahan dimana letak kamar hanya memberitahu no ruangan dan petunjuk menuju lift jg kurang sehingga saat di dalam sempat kebingungan padahal hotelnya tidak besar, ada kolam renang yg ukurannya kecil sekali di tengah (outdoor) dan banyak tamu yg merokok di area situ. Sesampainya di kamar saat kami kembali ke bawah untuk memasukkan barang bawaan tidak ada satupun staff yg menawarkan bantuan untuk membawakan tas kami yg lumayan banyak (padahal lewat receptionist dan mereka sempat melihat dan memanggil untuk memberitahu kamar yg satunya masih belum siap juga). Semua ketidakramahan itu masih saya abaikan. Sampai saat malam hari sepulang mencari makan malam, saat kembali ke hotel. Kami tamu hotel tidak kebagian parkir krn area parkir yg kecil itu penuh dengan mobil tamu undangan. Dan saat kami masuk kami lebih dikejutkan karena suara musik menggelegar keras sekali. Dan untuk masuk ke kamar kami harus melewati kerumunan tamu undangan wedding, kepulan asap rokok yg sangat tidak baik untuk anak anak (karena banyak tamu undangan wedding yg merokok) dan melewati spiker besar dengan musik yg sangat kencang suaranya, sampai di kamar pun suara musik itu masih terdengar keras. 
Tragedi makin parah terjadi saat salah satu kamar tidak bisa dibuka kuncinya dan saat itu kami harus turun kembali melewati kerumunan org untuk komplain ke reception. Saat komplain pun staff tidak tanggap hanya mengecek kunci dari reception saja. Dan bilang kalau sudah bisa digunakan nyatanya saat kami coba kartu belum bisa membuka jg. Jadi sekali lagi kami harus lewat kerumunan orang banyak dan musik yang keras. 
Dan akhirnya baru ada staff yg ikut ke atas untuk mencoba membuka pintu. Dan akhirnya baru bisa di buka. 
Dan music dari acara wedding pun baru berhenti pukul 10 malam. 
Kesan pertama menginap di hotel ini sangat buruk, sangat disayangkan padahal bangunan cukup bagus karena ada heritagenya dan lokasi bagus di tengah kota sekali. 
Semoga management dapat melakukan perbaikan pelayanan kedepannya. Dan mempertimbangkan dengan area hotel yang sangat kecil itu tidak seharusnya menyewakan tempat untuk acara wedding dengan musik yang sangat keras karena itu sangat mengganggu tamu yang lain.

Pesan tambahan: saat akan booking hotel ini sebaiknya pastikan tidak ada acara wedding atau acara lain yang menggunakan musik dengan keras. 

Maaf saya tidak melampirkan foto, karena mood untuk memotret sejak pertama datang karena ketidakramahan yang diterima.

text:
Saya menginap disini sebagai transit menuju Jakarta. Hotel ini memiliki paduan yang unik, nuansa tempo dulu di bagian lobby/reception karena memang bangunan lama dan nuansa modern untuk disain kamarnya. Lokasinya strategis sekali, bisa berjalan kaki menuju alun2, hypermart dan dekat dgn ATM berbagai bank. Proses check in sangat cepat, staf nya ramah dan fast response.

Untuk viewed kamar sebagian besar menghadap ke kolam berenang. Hanya kamar tipe balkon yang memiliki viewed kota Pekalongan. Menurut saya, kolam renangnya agak tidak lazim, berada di tengah bangunan hotel, bentuknya seperti kolam untuk air mancur.

Kamarnya luas, bersih dan sangat nyaman, beberapa disain interiornya membuat menginap terasa hommy. Menu sarapan sangat variatif dan rasa yang lezat. Tersedia menu tradisional tahu campur, jamu kunyit asam dan beras kencur.

text:
Setelah semalam di hotel Sahid Mandarin, kami memutuskan pindah dan mencari hotel yang di tengah kota, dari 3 hotel yang kami sambangi, Dafam, Namira Syariah dan the Sidji, akhirnya kami memutuskan untuk memilih the Sidji (dengan pertimbangan kebersihan, harga, lokasi dan terutama keputusan dari anak kami.... wkwkwk).
Dari awal masuk lobby, suasana Tionghoa peranakan yang kental sudah terasa, dimana suasana lobby dengan pintu dan sebagian tegel yang masih bernuansa jaman rumah nenek buyut kami di Pekalongan dengan pintu tebal, cat hijau muda kombinasi sentuhan putih.  Tengah ada kolam renang kecil yang dikelilingi gedung kamar hotel dengan nuansa minimalis modern. Serta coffee shop dan resto dengan versi jadul modern.......hmmmm kebayang ga ya???
Staff yang ramah dan membantu. Dimana setelah showing, kami putuskan untuk ambil kamar classic (biasanya disebut standar/superior). Untuk breakfast cukup enak....menurut anak kami, karena buat saya, ke Pekalongan dan makan makanan hotel adalah membuang kesempatan untuk wisata kuliner di Pekalongan.
Lokasi tidak jauh dari salah satu chain supermarket besar dan juga tidak jauh dari sumber jajanan Pekalongan di area alun" dekat mesjid.
Over all kalau masih ada promosi harga, kami akan kembali menginap di hotel ini yang kami anggap bersih, unik,

text:
The Sidji in Pekalongan is a delightful mix of Peranaken history & modern luxury. Both tastefully & thoughtfully brought together to create a unique boutique hotel. The staff were all locals who were incredibly friendly & most helpful. They seemed so excited we had come to their small town to bask in the delights it has to offer. The food was plentiful & a nice mix of local & western, with a cafe that possibly made the only cafe latte in town!! 

We also were taken by Abdul to visit a most interesting character Pak Zahir who has been researching for many years the art of indigo dyeing for batik. He has worked tirelessly to get Pekalongan and Indonesia's batik recognised by UNESCO & created the Museum of Batik (which is definitely worth visiting). 

A ride around town in the Sidji's becak is also a must. Visit the Chinese temple's & the old mosques in comfort. We came from Bali via Solo. A relatively short train trip from Solo to Pekalongan was done with ease. 

Thanks to Pak Adi & all the staff at the Sidji Hotel for a most memorable stay. See you again very soon!
title: Heritage Beauty in the Batik Town

owner_response.text:
Thank you so much @Star0309 for sharing your pleasant experience with us at The Sidji. We are glad that our team has made you feel welcome and serviced you with our local hospitality. Our lobby house has had so much history behind it and we have preserved it to share the story to our valued guests in a comfort of our modern facility. 
Pak Zahir's indigo batik workshop is an excellent way to learn about the history of batik and at the same time to get your hands-on making beautiful indigo batik pieces in one day. We are pleased that you got to experience to do that too. 
It sounds that you had a wonderful time in Pekalongan.
We look forward to welcome you back at The Sidji and to enjoy our latte.

Your sincerely, 
The Sidji Management

text:
When I visited Pekalongan, to be honest ... I didn't expect to stay in a good hotel or comfortable hotel with big city standards. I just chose to stay at the hotel sidji without checking the reviews on tripadvisor. Just blindly chose!
Cheap hotel in the tiny town, what do you expect?

The hotel location itself is very strategic, near the main square city, called alun alun.. Which is center of city. Also not far from shopping center and a large supermarket. 
so, I chose the sidji hotel because of its location.

when I arrived at the hotel, It felt like when I'm back home....homey hotel!

The staff were very friendly and polite. Different to the staff at the major hotels, the staff at the sidji hotel way more comunicative, helpful and care to every guest.

The main part of the hotel is decorated in such a colonial era complete with an old furniture but not excessive. 
Their tiny restaurant has eclectic style, people call it an instagramable restaurant.. 
And the room has modern style, i was staying in classic king room at day 1 and upgrade to deluxe with balcony room at day 2. Both rooms are comfortable! 
The breakfast selection at the sidji hotel's  restaurant are not much but all is delicious.

Unfortunately the pool are just for kids and that's exactly what the staff explained to me, so I can't complain about the swimming pool .. lol!

"I feel I got more than I paid" experience when i stay at sidji hotel.. Really!

Overall, this hotel will be my destination to stay when I visit to pekalongan in future. Also, I highly recommend this hotel to everyone who stopped at pekalongan!
title: "I got more than I paid" hotel!

text:
Arrived in Pekalongan city at noon, after driving from Bandung for 6 hours, we could immediately feel the heat right after we opened the car doors. But upon entrance of the hotel lobby, we could feel the cool breeze from the aircon. Warmly welcomed by the front desk person, we immediately checked-in to our room.

The room are spacious with simple (but new and modern) furniture. The bed are big enough for us (baby, husband and i), clean bedding with great pillows. The only downside was the super thin walls between rooms, because you can clearly hear people talking and laughing from the other rooms.

The bathroom size are ok, with working hot water. Basic amenities provided such as shampoo, conditioner, and toothbrush. They also provide hairdryer, which i found as a plus point, because not every hotel did that.

Breakfast were great with Indonesian cuisine, they also served traditional food such as Megono (famous food from Pekalongan), Gudeg, etc.

The Sidji have swimming pool, on the first look it doesn't look like a swimming pool, more on just a pool in the center of the hotel, but it is a swimming pool. Swimming pool for kids more precisely.

Hotel location is great, near to Alun-alun Kota and supermarket (15mins walking) and also near to several batik village.

My overall review? If u plan to visit Pekalongan, do stay in this hotel, you'll feel like home.
title: Hotel you can called Home

text:
When we arrived we felt a great hospitality came from the staff right away. And it was easy to check in. As we went to our room, we found the room was nicely done. Everything we needed was there. The bed was comfy, the air conditioning was no joke (because sometimes some places' doesn't get cool much), and we were so happy that the internet connection was fast and stable. It didn't matter where you are in the hotel, its gets connected automatically.
The price we got was breakfast included. And they served pretty good selection of Indonesian food. The only thing we would recommend to be improved is the quality of the coffee. Since its in Java, we think that splurge a little bit more on great java coffee would be even more fantastic. But that was just a minor thing really.
Our main destination was to buy lots of Pekalongan batiks. And The Sidji location is wonderful. We got to Kampung Kauman and Kampung Pesindon easily by foot.
We could also find different kind of signature dishes of Pekalongan around the hotel. In the evening, all we to do just go to alun alun.
We would definitely come back here again if we go to Pekalongan. So thank you!!!
title: Great service, lovely breakfast, and reliable internet connection

text: This is a beautiful hotel in the middle of Pekalongan.  The original owners have converted their home into a 5 star hotel which matches its wonderful history with perfect decor and service.  The staff are gracious and well trained, the food is great and very varied including some dishes I have never tried before.  The rooms are extremely comfortable and come with all the amenities you expect.  And right out the front door is a beautiful Javanese town with arguably the best batik in the world and hidden heritage treasures around every corner.    Anyone who wants to see an authentic part of Indonesia needs to come here.
title: A destination in itself!

text: It's really refreshing to have a high standard hotel in Pekalongan. The heritage part of the hotel is impressive. The facade of the hotel looks like a colonial home, very warm and inviting. When we entered, we were greeted by friendly staff, it felt like entering someone's living room, very warm and cozy with colonial decor. Many of the furnitures and decorations were left from the original house owners. We didn't use the meeting facilities, but I was told that the original bedrooms have been converted into meeting rooms. The corridors of the meeting rooms leads to a lovely terrace of Cafe Pontjol. It's a cozy & breezy place to have, what I believe, is the best coffee in town. The terrace looks onto the courtyard and pool area with Nostalgia restaurant on the right. We've eaten in the restaurant several times during our stay for breakfast and dinner. The food was excellent!!! We stayed in one of their suite rooms, it felt like staying in a five star hotel in Jakarta, we almost forgotten that we were in Pekalongan. The bed and pillows were so comfy, it was hard to wake up in the morning, but most importantly it was clean!!! Overall it was a really nice stay!
title: The best hotel in Pekalongan

text:
We stayed at the Sidji while attending an event at the hotel. We didnt expect much before we arrived at the hotel, but it turned out to be an unforgettable experience. 
We were welcomed by the most beautiful lobby preserving the existing Dutch influenced building enhanced with modern touch. The reception staff was very professional and served us very fast for our check in. 
The corridor to the hotel was simple but beautifully decorated with some Batik fabric wall display which represents Pekalongan as Batik city.
The room was very clean and so was the bathroom (super important for us as guests). We asked for an extra pillow which was quickly delivered to our room. Have to compliment the comfy and medium firmness pillow with very clean linen.
Breakfast was excellent, we loved the very delicious and properly made Jamu which is rarely served in a 4 star hotel. The choice was perfect and each menu were cooked well. Bread and butter was high quality( I always pay attention to this, as most 4 stars hotel use margarine instead of butter). Service was fast, and the waiter very quickly clean our table from the empty plates. 
Check out was again very fast and the friendly reception staff chatted with us while waiting for the room to be inspected upon our check out.

Overall, great job Sidji!  We surely will come back during our next visit!
title: Beautiful Oasis in the Middle of Batik City

text: I booked the suite room, which was very spacious. It had a living room, which was separate from the master bedroom. I also love the bathroom with its bath tab! The Sidji Hotel's breakfast was delicious - it's been a while since I found the good food at a hotel. The location was also very strategic as it's right at the heart of the city. If you want to go to Alun-Alun, you can just walk there for 5 mins. The hotel also has a Batik store if you want to shop (Pekalongan is famous for its Peranakan style Batik). You can also rent a becak to go around the city. My family also loves the homey and nostalgic vibes of the hotel. This quality is very important to me because Pekalongan is not a big city, so my intention to go there was mostly just to chill at the hotel. Therefore the quality of the hotel was paramount to me. Given that the hotel was also historical (former private residence), it had some interesting photo spots too for your Instagram. The hotel staffs are also friendly and helpful. If I visit Pekalongan again, I'll definitely book my room here!
title: Homey vibes with excellent hospitality

text: The hotel is strategically located in the city center so we can easily reach other destinations especially the culinary treats. Every corner is a photo-worthy area and you just can't stop to snap more pictures. The food and drinks also come in a very pocket-friendly prices for a "hotel" standard. Don't forget to try the coffee in Cafe Pontjol (my fave is the Affogato) and Oriental Sarsaparilla with Kopyor Float (vintage alert!). We arrived in the evening and was picked-up by the hotel at the train station. 
We received a warm welcome by the staff on duty. We felt so welcomed, everyone was so attentive and I felt it was a genuine effort from them to make our stay as comfortable as it can be. 

The place is awesome. It is a heritage hotel, the rooms provides all the amenities of a modern hotel. So many features of the hotel was Instagramable.

The hotel is centrally located. Shopping and eateries are walking distance from the hotel. 

Definitely I would comeback and recommend friends to stay at this hotel.
title: Owesome Experience in a Heritage Hotel

text: This hotel reminds me of my great grandparents house which built in colonial era. Its like we stepped into those memories of sleeping over at their house, sitting on those type of chairs with some antique furniture etc. Bedrooms were decent, and clean. Maybe needs a little fix here and there, not big. Staffs were friendly and helpful. They will show you some heritage rooms, and tell you the story behind it. Food were delicious, especially “ikan nenek moyang” and “tauto beef soto” you should try these! One thing only, when we asked for one mineral water the morning on check out day in the room, the room service staff said we could not since we are checking out later that day. I solved this issue by asking directly to the housekeeper passed by our room, and he was very kind to give us 2 bottles. Small kind things goes a long way, for sure!

This is my second time to The Sidji, the first was a few months after it had opened. It's a beautiful, charming hotel. You can tell that much thought and care was put into the conservation of the old Dutch house. The whole hotel is tastefully decorated. it is a peaceful sanctuary to come back to after a day discovering Pekalongan batiks or just walking around the city.
The hotel staff were another of the hotel's gem. They were all very welcoming, helpful, polite. The smiles that they gave were always genuine. Do have a cappuccino at their small café, it's very good! Do ask the hotel staff where to go, where to eat. They have excellent recommendations. The hotel's location makes it easy to go everywhere. There residential streets just off the main roads are very nice, very clean, quiet with many old houses.
I'll most certainly recommend The Sidji to friends and will come back again.

text:
A hotel which has a vintage touch to it. Walking distance to the alun-alun, where you can find various food stalls(the best LONTONG OPOR!) and also near Plaza Pekalongan. Not far from the train station (plus free transport provided to-and-from the station!) 

Breakfast was average. I was frustrated with the hot shower (level 3) as it oftens automatically swap from warm to very warm suddenly. The room door was also a challenge to open. Sensor works fine but it locks again pretty fast thus you might be finding yourself having to attempt more than once to open the room door.

I requested for late check out as my train was at 11pm.  I paid an additional 50% of the room daily cost for this but was pretty sad that I was only allowed me to check out as late as 6pm, which is a a bit unfair. 8pm would have been fine.

Overall okay. Value for money but could do better. 

PLUS point: Staffs were very friendly :)

The rooms are modern, clean, well serviced with modern functioning bathrooms.
The staff are wonderful, friendly, multilingual and go out of their way to make you feel at home.
Booked in for two nights and ended up staying three weeks!

text:
My family and I arrived one day after new year and we had a wonderful stay at the Sidji Hotel. 

We arrived around midnight and we were hungry, tired and sleepy at that time. There were no restaurant open but luckily Nostalgic restaurant was able to serve us with some food.

The staff were all polite and friendly. They asked us how's our day and greet us with happy new year with smile even though it was midnight. 

The check in process was fast, the room was perfect.

When we checked out the next day, everything also went well. 

Oh! I almost forgot to tell you that they also have batik shop in front of the hotel and its totally cheap compared to outside market! My mom is a batik lover and she knows batik price. She loved it and bought some batik for me and my sister.

One thing I like the most about this hotel is the lobby. It looks like a classic traditional Indonesian house with a little touch of modernism. I also took an instagram story of the lobby and many of my friends asked me where am I because it looks pretty.
title: Clean, friendly, and pretty all in one place

Me and my family spend 2 nights in the hotel during last new year holiday and it turns out to be one of our exciting moments starting from the pickups at the train station was on time, the staffs are helpful in informing you delicious local dishes in the city, they have their own "becak" so you can ensure that your trip circling the town is safe.

The hotels has old style house as lobby and some meeting rooms in it which reminds me back to my grandparents type of home. off course this will be on top of new 4 floor new building with nicely designed rooms with grand ballroom on the ground floor

We also tried the food at hotel restaurant on our 1st day for dinner and it is very delicious with reasonable price. I recommend the fried fish there which I am sorry to forget the exact name of the menu.

Pekalongan is famous for it's batik, despite of plenty of batik stores in the city for you to do your shopping, right next to the hotel they have a batik shop with a good selection in case you have limited time to stroll around the city 

overall it was a very nice experience and we will definitely visit again sometimes in the future on our planned road trip to Java.

text: Two rejuvenating days at this charming hotel, which combines a boutique colonial vibe but with modern amenities in a historic and laid back Javanese city. The front of the hotel is a renovated family home with furniture, photographs and appointments evoking the city's colonial past. The Sidji Hotel is a single becak (pedicab) ride away from famous local restaurants where you can sample unique Pekalongan dishes. The Sidji staff had that relaxed Indonesian graciousness, that makes one feel like a family guest. The menu was simple but stylish, with local dishes of Soto Tauco (soybean paste soup) and Megono (stewed jackfruit and coconut) as good as anywhere in town. After savoring Pekalongan food in the courtyard, you can retired to the rooms, in the 'new' part of the hotel which are great value at about Rp.480,000 with breakfast included. Pekalongan itself is a leading center for production of Batik, Indonesia's signature wax-dyed cloth with many colonial-era bungalows and mansions dotting the building. I look forward to my next relaxing train trip from Jakarta to this gem of a hotel.
title: Charming boutique hotel

text:
The Siji ( meaning 'one' in Javanese) has a very central location and is good value at the Rp 481,000 we paid for each ot two inter-connecting rooms with breakfast included.
The rooms ( nos. 505 and 506) are in a building abour two years old are were very clean and well-appointed, including flat screen TV with CNN and al-Jazeera in English, a coffee maker, bar fridge and safe. The beds were very comfortable ( not hard as in many Indonesian hotels) and the light was good for reading in bed. The view was mostly the wall of the next building, but we could also see the pool next to the restaurant. The wifi worked very well in our room. The bathroom was very clean, with good hot water and thick towels. Our only complaint with the rooms was that the TV channels available did not match those on the list, and we could not get the Australia+ channel.
There was a good choice of Indonesian and Western items for breakfast while facing the pool, the black coffee was really good and we enjoyed the oldies-style music in the background. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the TV technician came quickly but was unable to get the Australian channel we wanted.
The entrance and lobby are in a very nice heritage building with stained glass windows, and are all that's left of whatever large building was there before. We were pleased that some heritage has been preserved, so that although our rooms were so modern and squeaky-clean we did not feel we were staying in just another identikit modern hotel.
There is some limited room for off-street parking in the front.
title: Very clean and well-appointed rooms in new building, with nice heritage features in old building

owner_response.text:
Dear @Stickman1,

We appreciate the time you've spared in writing the review. We are pleased that our service and facilities made your stay comfortable. It was our intention when building The Sidji to preserve our 90-year old family heritage house which is now the hotel lobby, combined with brand new building with modern facilities. Our guest comfort is what we always strive to achieve. We apologize that the Australian TV channel did not work for you. It turned out the disk was affected by a failure of one of Telkom's satellites. The problem has since been fixed and it will be available when you come and visit us next time. 

We look forward to welcome you back in The Sidji next time.

Yours sincerely, 
The Sidji Management
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: On our way to Jakarta, from our East Java trip, we stop by and stayed at the Sidji Hotel Pekalongan. Entering the Hotel you felt like you are entering an old charmed peranakan house, which I believe is the beauty of this hotel. The blend of the old peranakan house facade with modern building behind as hotel rooms and other facilities created really a nostalgic ambiance. While the old houses along the street are gone. The Sidji hotel still conserve the house. It is really a great experience to stay at this hotel. The room are equipped with modern facilities, spacious and clean. The service is excellent. We enjoyed very much the Indonesian cuisine including the popular Soto of Pekalongan : Soto Tauto in Nostalgia Restaurant. The staff are  so friendly too. With the strategic location, we can't expect more. We will always stay at this hotel when we come to Pekalongan again.
title: Nostalgic Stay at The Sidji Hotel Pekalongan

text:
This hotel is a jewerly of Java.
I loved the quiet & nostalgic atmosphere, antique furnitures, staff's Java-style uniform, clean room, nice souvenior shop, breakfast and so on.
I looked at the old books in a book shelf in a public area, and found some interesting books including an old Java map or English-Japanese dictionary.

The swimming pool is located in the center of patio where I suppose most people hesitate to swim being watched by other guests.

I came by train and picked up at the station by a hotel staff, so I didn't need to worry about the safety.

I asked for massage service and the receptionist kindly called a massagist from outside, but the massagist was an old woman who tried to take more money from me than she had promised at the beggining.
I hope that the hotel can provide appropriate massagists.

In general, I was very happy staying at this hotel and surely will come back.
title: Feel nostalgy of Java

owner_response.text:
Dear @rehashuna,

We are glad that you had a lovely stay at our hotel. The books you saw in the bookshelf were original books from the Hoo family, the family who built and owned the house, which was now the hotel lobby. 
Massage service is still quite rare in Pekalongan. Thank you for flagging us about your massage experience, we apologize for that. We certainly take this seriously and will take necessary action. 

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and we look forward to welcome you back the next time you come and visit Pekalongan.

The Sidji Management

text:
This hotel features a colonial-style old house as its lobby which is unique in a way. This however doesn't rhyme well with the hotel's modern-look.

How to connect these two features must've been indeed a challenge when they constructed firstly the hotel. Surely a professional touch us still needed.

Location-wise it is perfect as it is so close to basically all points of interests in the city of Pekalongan, Mid-Java Province.

The staffers are forthcoming and helpful as well while the room where I'm currently staying is clean and neat. 

The swimming pool is too tiny though perfect only for a dip or a Turkish bath. 

The city itself is in complete tatters. Take for example the city garden. It is full of shanty stalls selling anything you can imagine. 

Worse, the seaport is absolutely full of garbage, plastics in particular. People litter as they so wish as if the port is a garbage bin altogether.

I think the city mayor needs to be scolded for mismanaging the city, honesty.
title: Simply Simple

I'm sorry that you did not have a good experience in Pekalongan, hopefully the next visit will be better.

text:
Vous avez l'impression d'arriver chez des amis, car le premier bâtiment , est une demeure ancienne, dédiée a la réception .Accolé a ce bâtiment, un immeuble dans lequel se trouve les chambres , restaurant, piscine etc ....
Tout est neuf ou retapé , très élégant et vraiment hors du commun.
Donc , dans la grande cour intérieure se trouve la piscine , le restaurant et bar.
C'est calme et cosy, très agréable.
Les chambres , très propres, sont de conception moderne avec tous le confort nécessaire à un agréable séjour.
Le personnel est adorable et toujours prêt à vous aider.
Le restaurant sert a la fois les petits déjeuner sous forme de buffet , puis le déjeuner et dîner. La décoration est un mélange de contemporain avec son mur végétal et d'anciens avec ses bibelots et meubles chinois d'époque. Ravissant.
La piscine , au centre de la cour intérieure, fait plus penser à un bassin. Elle n'est pas très grande mais suffit pour le peu de personnes qui l'utilise.
Vous avez un garage souterrain à votre disposition, bien pratique.
title: Hotel original et confortable.

The Sidji Management
